articles.title: Apple reigns again as most valuable U.S. company for first time since January
articles.summary: Apple Inc. has once again become the most valuable U.S. company, surpassing Microsoft Corp. for the first time since January. The company ended Thursday's trading session with a market capitalization of $3.285 trillion after its stock rose 0.6%. Apple shares have advanced 10.9% over the past three sessions, adding $324 billion to its market cap.

articles.title: Private Cloud Compute: A new frontier for AI privacy in the cloud
articles.summary: Apple introduces Private Cloud Compute (PCC), a new cloud intelligence system designed for private AI processing with Apple Intelligence. PCC extends Apple's industry-leading device security and privacy to the cloud, ensuring personal user data remains inaccessible to anyone but the user, including Apple. The system is built with custom Apple silicon and a hardened operating system, featuring stateless computation, enforceable guarantees, no privileged access, non-targetability, and verifiable transparency for security researchers.

articles.title: Apple adds BNPL offerings from rivals
articles.summary: Apple is expanding its buy now, pay later (BNPL) offerings on Apple Pay by integrating services from rivals like Affirm and flexible financing options from debit and credit cards issued by Citi, Fiserv, and Synchrony. This move represents a shift from Apple's traditional "walled garden" strategy, potentially influenced by recent antitrust pressures and fines regarding third-party payment restrictions. While Affirm does not expect a material impact on its fiscal year 2025 revenue or gross merchandise volume from this partnership, it provides users with more payment choices and integrates with Apple Pay's security features.

articles.title: Nvidia overtakes Apple as No. 2 most valuable company
articles.summary: Nvidia's valuation has surpassed $3 trillion, making it the world's second most valuable company, overtaking Apple. The AI chipmaker's stock surge is attributed to high demand for its processors among tech giants building AI capabilities. This shift highlights Nvidia's dominance in the current AI landscape, while Apple faces challenges with iPhone demand and AI integration.

articles.title: Trade the AI Trend With This Pair of Leveraged ETFs
articles.summary: This article discusses how investors can capitalize on the booming artificial intelligence (AI) trend using leveraged ETFs. It highlights companies like Nvidia and Apple as key players in the AI space and introduces two Direxion leveraged ETFs, AIBU and AIBD, which offer 200% exposure to the Solactive US AI & Big Data Index for both upside and inverse plays. These ETFs provide traders with flexible options to express short-term convictions in the AI-big data sector.

articles.title: These San Diego and California companies made the 2024 For 500 list
articles.summary: California leads the nation with 57 companies on the 2024 Fortune 500 list, marking the first time in a decade it has surpassed Texas and New York. Three San Diego companies made the list: Qualcomm (No. 117), Sempra (No. 246), and LPL Financial Holdings (No. 392), despite Qualcomm's revenue decrease and layoffs. Nine new California-based companies joined the list, while others like Petco and Illumina are being watched for future inclusion.

articles.title: Trade the AI Trend With This Pair of Leveraged ETFs
articles.summary: This article discusses how investors can capitalize on the artificial intelligence (AI) trend using leveraged ETFs. It highlights companies like Nvidia and Apple as key players in the AI space and introduces two Direxion leveraged ETFs, AIBU and AIBD, which offer 200% exposure or inverse exposure to the Solactive US AI & Big Data Index, enabling traders to react to short-term market convictions.

articles.title: Ozempic Maker Novo Nordisk Closes In On Lego As Denmark's Most Valuable Brand: Report
articles.summary: Pharmaceutical giant Novo Nordisk is rapidly closing in on Lego A/S for the title of Denmark's most valuable brand, driven by the immense global popularity of its weight-loss drugs, Ozempic and Wegovy. While Lego saw a modest 3% brand value increase to $8 billion, Novo Nordisk's brand value surged by 59% to $5.1 billion, significantly impacting Denmark's GDP and making it Europe's most valuable company. Despite this growth, both companies remain far behind global leader Apple Inc., valued at $517 billion.

articles.title: The 3 Best ETFs to Buy in June 2024
articles.summary: This article highlights three top ETFs for June 2024: Avantis U.S. Large Cap Value ETF (AVLV), abrdn Bloomberg All Commodity Longer Dated Strategy K-1 Free ETF (BCD), and Vanguard U.S. Multifactor ETF (VFMF). These ETFs are recommended for their low expense ratios, solid performance, and positive Morningstar ratings, offering diversification and growth potential to investors.

articles.title: 5 things you need to know before nvidia's stock split.
articles.summary: This article details five crucial points regarding NVIDIA's upcoming 1:10 stock split, outlining what a stock split is, its impact on investors and options, historical stock performance post-split, and potential broader market effects. It explains how the split lowers the per-share price to attract more investors and could lead to increased liquidity, while also discussing the proportional adjustment of option contracts. The article also touches upon the "Nvidia Effect" on related stocks and the potential for NVIDIA's split to trigger a wave of similar actions in the US stock market among other high-priced S&P 500 constituents.

articles.title: 3 Great Funds for the Class of 2024
articles.summary: This article suggests three investment funds for the Class of 2024, suitable for new graduates entering the investment world. It highlights the US total stock market (like Schwab US Broad Market ETF) for broad diversification, target-date funds (such as Vanguard Target Retirement 2070 Fund) for retirement savings, and balanced funds (like BlackRock Sustainable Balanced) for medium-term goals with a focus on sustainability. The author emphasizes the importance of investing for the future while cautioning against using short-term savings for volatile investments.

articles.title: Trade the AI Trend With This Pair of Leveraged ETFs
articles.summary: The article discusses how investors can capitalize on the artificial intelligence (AI) trend through leveraged ETFs, specifically highlighting the performance of Nvidia and Apple. It introduces the Direxion Daily AI and Big Data Bull 2X Shares (AIBU) and Direxion Daily AI and Big Data Bear 2X Shares (AIBD) as tools for traders to gain 200% exposure to the Solactive US AI & Big Data Index. These ETFs offer flexibility for traders to express short-term convictions on the upside or downside of the AI and big data sector.

articles.title: Adobe Responds to AI Fears With Plans for Updated Legal Terms
articles.summary: Adobe Systems Inc. faced backlash from customers over updated terms of use, prompting a reevaluation of how the company communicates legal issues, especially concerning generative AI. General counsel Dana Rao emphasized that legal terms must evolve with technology. This incident highlights heightened scrutiny on terms of service as technology advances.
